instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but volume icon grayed
threads.message:
[FONT=arial][SIZE=14px]Hi everyone, I have a macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which emits the chime when powering up but when the system starts up I don't have any audio devices.

I checked the voltages on <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>

<SIGNAL>PP_3V3</SIGNAL> on pins 7-61-85
<SIGNAL>PP_4V5</SIGNAL> on pins 77-129

I noticed that if I plug the headphones into the jack the device detects the audio output on the headphones and the volume icon activates but no sound comes out of the headphones [/SIZE][/FONT]

[SIZE=14px]thank you all[/SIZE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> chime but volume icon grayed
threads.message:
Ceck all small diodes and coils on the audio connectors page.
Also clean the headphone connector; YouTube videos available.
